question: 磁石
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>magnet</kanji> <kanji>stone</kanji> is a <vocabulary>magnet</vocabulary>. Magnets look like little stones, right?
sourceReadingMnemonic: The <ja>磁</ja> reading makes sense. The <ja>しゃく</ja> reading for <ja>石</ja> is an exception. To remember this, just think how you are using a magnet to find this <reading>shack</reading> (<ja>しゃく</ja>) full of other magnets. It pulls you towards the shack, and when you find it and open it, all the magnets fly out and crush you because of magnety reasons.
